nestedPage.text: Life in the UK During semester 2, each person will, with a partner, give a presentation about an aspect of life in the UK with regard to you, the ELFIS students. Each pair will have two weeks to prepare for their presentation.

Your presentation will be judged by your tutor and by other students in the class. Twice during the semester you will have to write a short report assessing the presentations of four of your classmates (two pairs). Each person will have to give an approximately five minute presentation which will, with your partner, fully explore the aspect of life in the UK that you are allocated as it could affect you as ELFIS students (2 x 5 minutes = 10 minute presentations).

You must have an interesting and informative set of slides. You could have handouts. Your presentations need to be imaginative, interesting and informative. What you present is up to you. You could look at causes and effects, or compare and contrast between the UK and China, or give explanations, examples and advice, or…

Topics: • Accommodation, transport, food • Health and safety • Homesickness • Social life • Budgeting, banking, money • Responsibilities and expectations of students (what is expected of the students) • Academic life, courses, students’ expectations (what the students expect), planning, time management You will be allocated a date and a topic. If you want to alter your topic, ask your tutor (anything could be acceptable).
